name: Alice Baldwin Beer
biography:
In 1948, Alice Baldwin Beer was hired as Keeper of Needlework in the textile department of the Cooper Union Museum. She became Keeper of Textiles in 1950. The title "Keeper" was changed to "Curator" in October 1958. In 1970, she retired and became Consultant for Textiles. Beer was named Curator Emeritus in 1979, a position she held until her death in November 1981. 

(Source: Smithsonian Archives, http://siarchives.si.edu/collections/siris_arc_217103)
